intro: Galatella biflora, commonly known as the two-flowered galatella, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley. The plant features slender stems and small, white or greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, giving it a delicate, fern-like appearance. Galatella biflora is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to coastal environments.
